description: Smallest prime with square excess of n.
example: a(4)=13 since 13=3^2+4, while 2, 3, 5, 7 and 11 have square excesses of 1, 2, 1, 3 and 3 respectively.
maple: A056893 := proc(n)    local p ;    p :=2 ;    while A053186(p) <> n do        p := nextprime(p) ;    end do:    return p ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 28 2013
prog: (PARI) A056893(n)={    local(p=2) ;    while( A053186(p)!=n,        p=nextprime(p+1)    ) ;    return(p)} /* _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 28 2013 */
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 05 2000
